title: Does time exist at all points simultaneously? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve been working on the “Unified Field Theory”; one of the issues it addresses is the very question you posed, namely, whether time exists simultaneously at all points or not. Here is the answer (according to my version of the “Unified Field Theory”). Simultaneity in time depends upon establishing a “unified field domain.” This is established by consciousness, unity, and love. Note the importance of consciousness first. The reason for that is that consciousness is in the same dimension as both time and the quantum wave, namely the abstract, complex, metaphysical realm. The second factor is unity. This addresses the social realm or issue. When unity of heart in love is established among people, they form a unified domain, or a unified realm of collective consciousness, which then transcends the individual level and becomes a social unified field domain. This is important because the true reality of our world is not only material, not only inorganic, but becomes unified in the deepest sense when human beings in the social context become united in love. This is in fact “The Kingdom of Heaven.” In other words, true “simultaneity” and “unity” are not fully achieved until the actual Kingdom of Heaven is realized. That time has already begun now. The third element, love is necessary, because “unity” is not just achieved by consensus, agreement, financial or legal contract, social contract, constitution, law, government, military force, etc. Love is the essential core of the Kingdom of Heaven, and also the most essential unifying element in the Unified Field Theory. Namely, it’s not merely a humanistic concept, but in fact is the essential force or foundation which causes the essential metaphysical and also quantum world to become one, and to attain “simultaneity.” Until now physics, quantum mechanics, and science in general has been “sterile”, i.e., has been attempting to build the structure of all science, which is termed the “Unified Field Theory” (as a purely physical construct) and the “Theory of Everything” (based on sheerly conceptual or rational principles). However, the true Unified Field Theory can describe how and why the unified field domain can be established in a spatial realm, social realm, conceptual realm, and above all heartistic realm. As we know, with Einstein’s Special Theory of Relativity, time and space, matter and energy are all determined by the photon, the speed of light, as the standard. This is true, within the physical realm, but not within the quantum realm where simultaneity has been established centered on unity, consciousness and love. As we already know, there seems to be some contradiction between quantum mechanics and relativity in the point of “time” and “simultaneity.” In fact, Special Relativity forbids any material transport or communication faster than light. At the same time, it has already been amply experimentally established that the quantum wave in all its parts, however distantly separated are unified instantaneously. Now there is a special clause: This can never be used for communication (at least as far as we know at present). There seems to be a contradiction: Einstein’s theory effectively defines “simultaneity” centered upon the light cone based on the speed of light. However, what if the two objects or people were to transmit to each other “simultaneously”? Then the definition of “simultaneity” would be broken or violated, and “simultaneity” collapses. Therefore, when the two points are in a prearranged agreement, “simultaneity” in the relativistic definition becomes meaningless. The Unified Field Theory solution to this is that, once partners or a community become fully united in agreement, in time definition, in consciousness and in love, then a true, perfect unified field domain is established within their realm. In this case, the physical-world, Einsteinian definition of “simultaneity” is superseded and the quantum realm or Kingdom of Heaven realm of true simultaneity is established among them. Astronomers are already using “universal time” standards (which are technically illegitimate until the actual Kingdom of Heaven is realized); this is a nod to that which is to come. In this definition, all parties participating in the unified domain of the Kingdom of Heaven (of true love, unity, and consciousness) come under one Unified Field Domain, and thus true heavenly simultaneity is established. This is how time will be unified in the Kingdom of Heaven.

Time is the rate and duration of a process. Time is a metric, a numerical value we assign to count the intervals of a sequence of actions comprising some process we are observing. We can’t say “time exists” as if it was some physical, tangible “thing” that exists outside of our minds. Motion exists; time is how we compare motions. It exists in the minds of people thinking about measuring, comparing motions. The word “simultaneous” indicates you think of reality as a collection of separate events. OK. I think of reality as One Event and it is happening Now, the only moment there is; the only moment there ever was and ever will be, the only moment that can “exist”.

Current models of our universe as a whole assume a uniform distribution of everything including time: uniform mass density decreasing uniformly with universal time at the scale of the universe. Just one universal time. Our universe currently has regions of mass concentration: galaxy clusters; that are huge from our perspective but negligible inhomogeneities at the scale of the universe. There are as many times as there are things in relative motion within these “local” inhomogeneities. They are gravitationally isolated from universal time as well as the centerless expansion of the universe as a whole.
Time exists at all points, but does not pass at the same rate at all points, so not simultaneously. Relative velocity alters the speed at which time passes relative to a 'fixed' frame of reference.
Yes but what are simultaneous events one observer are not simultaneous to another observer in a relative motion.

“It” is now everywhere, ongoing. It doesn’t depend on who sees what when from where, as images carried by light travel through space, which “takes time.” Time does not exist as an entity but rather as a concept, like the duration of one rev. on Earth’s axis or one orbit around the Sun. All movement “takes time.” The error is in making “something” of it.
Yes, all points of space have a time coordinate. Simultaneity depends on your state of motion.
